Patch Set 14:

(2 comments)

Patch Set 14: Code-Review+1

(4 comments)

I guess the usb-gadget name should be related to the Slot_X that it will be mounted for.
The current way doesn't allow to mount several (web-proxy and legacy-device) at the same time because their usb-gadget names will be `usb0` for both slots.

I am so sorry, that those comments hasn't been addressed so far, I just missed them. I'll try to answer them now, hoping it will still be helpful.

Gadget device is related to the directory that is created in the "/sys/kernel/config/usb_gadget" directory. We don't use multiple devices inside on gadget to simplify maintaining gadgets.
Done
Could the `manufacturer` and the `product` strings be adjusted via configuration file or DBus-object?
Yes, this could be changed. We didn't have the obligation to differentiate devices that way, so we do not customize the name.
Done
I guess there should be a way to specify kind of VM (VM-type): USB-Stick or CD/DVD-ROM. But I guess this might be added by another PR (I already have a proposal and patches for this feature).
We haven't noticed any benefits with customizing this. No matter what type of mass storage we used, the device behaved the same way.
Done

What if the found port will be p0 or p1 that is not yet binded by iKVM feature (virtual HID)? 
I can figure out a case where KVMIP will be broken:
* KVMIP session is not yet activated
* User try to mount some VM-device and this code part binds the vhub:p0
  This operation goes success.
* The user try to activate KVMIP session, this leads to take a attempt to bind virtual mouse on vhub:p0 and virtul keyboard on vhub:p1.
  The vhub:p0 already binded by VM-session and this leads to broken virtual-mouse for KVMIP feature.
  
Is I describing the real case or am I missing something?

Yes, I think this could render a problem to use the same slot for different functionalities (if I understood you correctly). This could be handled using multifunction devices (when needed), but this would introduce some complexity to track status of gadget device on both sides (VM i KVM).
Done
Why is this useful (answer in your commit message)
?  Then why should we merge this patch if it adds a bunch of code with no function?
